{{Wired embedded system |brand=Hardkernel |model=ODROID |revision=M1 (8GB) Rev 1.0 |asin=B09XQQ39G5 |manuf_country=Korea |is_manuf=Yes |price=90 |est_release_date=03/2022 |type=single-board computer |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.5 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |cpu1_brand=Rockchip |cpu1_model=RK3568;RK3568B2; |cpu1_cspeed=2.0 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25U12832F |ram1=8 GiB |ram1_brand=SK hynix |ram1_model=H9HCNNNFAMML-XRNEE |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (M.2), USB 3.0, USB 2.0, SATA 3.0 |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num=4 |expansion_sata_num=1 |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (1500000 8N1) |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8211F |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=1 |addl_chips=Power Management IC;Rockchip;RK809-5;;1;,,, PCI Express Clock;Diodes Inc;PI6C557-03;;1;,,, USB Power Distribution Switch;First Silicon;FC6261;;2;,,, 3.3V, 8A Synchronous Buck Converter w/ 100mA LDO;MPS;NB680;;1;,,, 5.5V, 6A, 2.4MHz Synchronous Step Down Regulator;Silergy;SYR838;;1;,,, Two-Port, High-Speed, USB2.0 UART Switch;ON Semi;FSUSB42MUX;;1;,,, 28V, 6A Synchronous Step Down Regulator;Silergy;SY8366H;;1;,,, 2-Channel ESD Protection for USB 3.0;TI;TPD2EUSB30;;4;,,, 2A Synchronous Buck Converter;First Silicon;FC3470;;1;,,, 300mA CMOS Linear Regulator;First Silicon;FC8731;;1;,,, 0.2A Single Channel Load Switch;Diodes Inc;AP2331;;1;,,, 38V High Efficiency, Boost WLED Driver w/ PWM Control;SG Micro;SGM3752;;1;,,, |flags=MicroSD Card slot, HDMI 2.0, Audio out (3.5mm), Audio out (JST 2.0), eMMC module socket, MIPI DSI, MIPI CSI, RTC w/ battery, IR receiver, I2C, SPI, PWM, UART, GPIO |stock_boot=U-Boot; |stock_os=Linux;4.19.219;Ubuntu 20.04; |tp_firmware=Android 11 |default_ip=acquired via DHCP |default_user=odroid |default_pass=odroid |oui_eth=00:1E:06 }} {{TagLine|Single Board Computer - ODROID-M1 (8GB)}} :[https://www.hardkernel.com/shop/odroid-m1-with-8gbyte-ram/ Product page]
"ODROID-M1", "REV 1.0 20211112", "Made In Korea", and "HARDKERNEL" are silkscreened on board top. :"Made In Korea" and "Design by ruppi.kim@hardkernel.com" are silkscreened on board bottom.
eMMC module connector with modules of 8GB, 16GB, 32GB, 64GB and 128GB available.
{{See also|ODROID#Models|List of Single-board computers}}
===Links=== *[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ODROID ''ODROID'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[https://wiki.odroid.com/odroid-m1/odroid-m1 ''ODROID-M1'' on '''ODROID''' Wiki] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2022/03/29/hardkernel-launches-odroid-m1-rockchip-rk3568b2-sbc/ ''Hardkernel launches ODROID-M1 Rockchip RK3568B2 SBC'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[https://linuxgizmos.com/hardkernels-newest-odroid-m1-enters-the-sbc-market%ef%bf%bc/ ''Hardkernelâ€™s newest ODROID-M1 enters the SBC market'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Rockchip]]'' RK3568B2 @2.0GHz Quad-Core :SoC: ARM (Cortex-A55); NPU: 0.8 TOPS *GPU: ''Mali-G52 MP2'' @650MHz (OpenGL ES3.2, OpenCL 2.0) :VPU (with 4K VP9 and 4K 10-bit H265/H264 decoding) *Storage: 16MB (SPI) Flash, eMMC module connector, :TF card (max.128GB)/MMC card, NVMe SSD (M.2) slot, :1x SATA 3.0 port *Memory: 8GB (LPDDR4) SDRAM @1560MHz (''SK hynix'') *USB: 2x USB 3.0, 2x USB 2.0, 1x USB 2.0 OTG ports :(USB 2.0 OTG has priority over 2nd USB 3.0 port) *PCIe: 1x M.2 (M key) socket *Network: 1x Gigabit Ethernet port *GPIO: 1x 40-pin headers *Power Source: 7.5V ~ 15.5V via barrel :(12V/2A recommended)
==Images== <gallery> File:ODROID M1 Top.jpeg|Board Top File:ODROID M1 Bottom.jpeg|Board Bottom </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
